doc.after: In the seventeenth century the English political philosopher Thomas Hobbes whose Leviathan advocated absolute monarchy admired Thucydides and in 1628 was the first to translate his writings into English directly from Greek Thucydides Hobbes and Machiavelli are together considered the founding fathers of political realism according to which state policy must primarily or solely focus on the need to maintain military and economic power rather than on ideals or ethics
